summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: begins with the words of the early preachers: “Listen! I will send My helper to carry the news ahead of you. He will make the way ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His voice calls out in the desert, ‘Make the way ready for the Lord. Make the road straight for Him!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John the Baptist preached in the desert. He preached that people should be baptized because they were sorry for their sins and had turned from them. And they would be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People from over all the country of Judea and from Jerusalem came to him. They told of their sins and were baptized by John in the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John wore clothes made of hair from camels. He had a leather belt around him. His food was locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He preached, saying, “One is coming after me Who is greater than I. I am not good enough to get down and help Him take off His shoes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have baptized you with water. But He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came to the Jordan River from the town of Nazareth in the country of Galilee. He was baptized by John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Jesus came up out of the water, He saw heaven open up. The Holy Spirit came down on Him like a dove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice came from heaven and said, “You are My much-loved Son. I am very happy with You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the Holy Spirit sent Jesus to a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was tempted by Satan for forty days there. He was with wild animals but angels took care of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After John the Baptist was put in prison, Jesus came to the country of Galilee. He preached the Good News of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The time has come. The holy nation of God is near. Be sorry for your sins, turn from them, and believe the Good News.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus was walking by the Sea of Galilee. He saw Simon and his brother Andrew putting a net into the sea. They were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Follow Me. I will make you fish for men!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: At once they left their nets and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went on a little farther. He saw James and his brother John who were sons of Zebedee. They were in a boat mending their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called them and they left their father Zebedee. He was in the boat with men who were working for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and His followers went to the city of Capernaum on the Day of Rest. They went to the Jewish place of worship where Jesus taught the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were surprised and wondered about His teaching. He taught them as One Who had the right and the power to teach and not as the teachers of the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man in the Jewish place of worship who had a demon. The demon cried out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do You want of us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know Who You are. You are the Holy One of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke sharp words to the demon and said, “Do not talk! Come out of the man!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The demon threw the man down and gave a loud cry. Then he came out of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were all surprised and wondered. They asked each other, “What is this? Is this a new teaching? He speaks with power even to the demons and they obey Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the news about Jesus went through all the country around Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and His followers came out of the Jewish place of worship. Then they went to the house of Simon and Andrew. James and John went with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told Jesus about Simon’s mother-in-law who was in bed, very sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went and took her by the hand and raised her up. At once her sickness was gone. She got up and cared for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the evening as the sun went down, the people took all who were sick to Jesus. They took those who had demons to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the town gathered at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus healed those who were sick of many kinds of diseases. He put out many demons. Jesus would not allow the demons to speak because they knew Who He was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning before the sun was up, Jesus went to a place where He could be alone. He prayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon and the others looked for Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found Him and said, “All the people are looking for You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the followers, “Let us go to the towns near here so I can preach there also. That is why I came.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He went through Galilee. He preached in their places of worship and put out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man came to Jesus with a bad skin disease. This man got down on his knees and begged Jesus, saying, “If You want to, You can heal me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus put His hand on him with loving-pity. He said, “I want to. Be healed.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: At once the disease was gone and the man was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke strong words to the man before He sent him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Tell no one about this. Go and let the religious leader of the Jews see you. Give the gifts Moses has told you to give when a man is healed of a disease. Let the leaders know you have been healed.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the man went out and talked about it everywhere. After this Jesus could not go to any town if people knew He was there. He had to stay in the desert. People came to Him from everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After some days Jesus went back to the city of Capernaum. Then news got around that He was home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon many people gathered there. There was no more room, not even at the door. He spoke the Word of God to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Four men came to Jesus carrying a man who could not move his body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These men could not get near Jesus because of so many people. They made a hole in the roof of the house over where Jesus stood. Then they let down the bed with the sick man on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the sick man, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Some teachers of the Law were sitting there. They thought to themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why does this Man talk like this? He is speaking as if He is God! Who can forgive sins? Only One can forgive sins and that is God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once Jesus knew the teachers of the Law were thinking this. He said to them, “Why do you think this in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Which is easier to say to the sick man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, take your bed, and start to walk?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I am doing this so you may know the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins.” He said to the sick man who could not move his body,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I say to you, ‘Get up. Take your bed and go to your home.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: At once the sick man got up and took his bed and went away. Everybody saw him. They were all surprised and wondered about it. They thanked God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus walked along the sea-shore again. Many people came together and He taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He walked farther and saw Levi (Matthew) the son of Alphaeus. Levi was sitting at his work gathering taxes. Jesus said to him, “Follow Me.” Levi got up and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus ate in Levi’s house. Many men who gather taxes and others who were sinners came and sat down with Jesus and His followers. There were many following Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers saw Jesus eat with men who gather taxes and others who were sinners. They said to His followers, “Why does He eat and drink with men who gather taxes and with sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard it and said to them, “People who are well do not need a doctor. Only those who are sick need a doctor. I have not come to call those who are right with God. I have come to call those who are sinners.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The followers of John and the proud religious law-keepers were not eating food so they could pray better. Some people came to Jesus and said, “Why do the followers of John and the proud religious law-keepers go without food so they can pray better, but Your followers do not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Can the friends at a wedding go without food when the man just married is with them? As long as they have him with them, they will not go without food.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The days will come when the man just married will be taken from them. Then they will not eat food so they can pray better.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No man sews a piece of new cloth on an old coat. If it comes off, it will make the hole bigger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man puts new wine into old skin bags. The skin would break and the wine would run out. The bags would be no good. New wine must be put into new skin bags.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: At that time Jesus walked through the grain-fields on the Day of Rest. As they went, His followers began to take some of the grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers said to Jesus, “See! Why are they doing what the Law says should not be done on the Day of Rest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he and his men were hungry?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He went into the house of God when Abiathar was head religious leader of the Jews. He ate the special bread used in the religious worship. The Law says only the Jewish religious leaders may eat that. David gave some to those who were with him also.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “The Day of Rest was made for the good of man. Man was not made for the Day of Rest.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Son of Man is Lord of the Day of Rest also.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus went into the Jewish place of worship again. A man was there with a dried-up hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers watched Jesus to see if He would heal the man on the Day of Rest. They wanted to have something to say against Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the man with the dried-up hand, “Stand up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the proud religious law-keepers, “Does the Law say to do good on the Day of Rest or to do bad, to save life or to kill?” But they said nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked around at them with anger. He was sad because of their hard hearts. Then He said to the man, “Put out your hand.” He put it out and his hand was healed. It was as good as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers went out and made plans with the followers of King Herod how they might kill Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went with His followers to the sea. Many people followed Him from the countries of Galilee and Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They followed from Jerusalem and from the country of Idumea. They came from the other side of the Jordan River and from the cities of Tyre and Sidon. Many people heard all that Jesus was doing and came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told His followers to have a small boat ready for Him because so many people might push Him down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had healed so many that the sick people were pushing in on Him. They were trying to put their hands on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When demons saw Him, they got down at His feet and cried out, “You are the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke strong words that the demons should tell no one Who He was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went up on a mountain and called those He wanted. They followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He picked out twelve followers to be with Him so He might send them out to preach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would have the right and the power to heal diseases and to put out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus gave Simon another name, Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John were brothers. They were the sons of Zebedee. He named them Boanerges, which means, The Sons of Thunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The others were Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Canaanite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas Iscariot. Judas was the one who handed Jesus over to be killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came into a house, many people gathered around Him again. Jesus and His followers could not even eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When His family heard of it, they went to take Him. They said, “He must be crazy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teachers of the Law came down from Jerusalem. They said, “Jesus has Satan in Him. This Man puts out demons by the king of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called them to Him and spoke to them in picture-stories. He said, “How can the devil put out the devil?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A nation cannot last if it is divided against itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A family cannot last if it is divided against itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the devil fights against himself and is divided, he cannot last. He will come to an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man can go into a strong man’s house and take away his things, unless he ties up the strong man first. Only then can he take things from his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, all sins will be forgiven people, and bad things they speak against God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone speaks bad things against the Holy Spirit, he will never be forgiven. He is guilty of a sin that lasts forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them this because they said, “He has a demon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His mother and brothers came and stood outside. They sent for Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people were sitting around Him. They said, “See! Your mother and brothers are outside looking for You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Who is My mother or My brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He turned to those sitting around Him and said, “See! My mother and My brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does what My Father wants is My brother and My sister and My mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus began to teach by the sea-shore again. Many people gathered around Him. There were so many He had to get into a boat and sit down. The people were on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught them many things by using picture-stories. As He taught, He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen! A man went out to plant seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he planted the seed, some fell by the side of the road. Birds came and ate them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seed fell among rocks. It came up at once because there was so little ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it dried up when the sun was high in the sky because it had no root.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seed fell among thorns. The thorns grew and did not give the seed room to grow. This seed gave no grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seed fell on good ground. It came up and grew and gave much grain. Some gave thirty times as much grain. Some gave sixty times as much grain. Some gave one hundred times as much grain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You have ears, then listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were with Jesus and the twelve followers came to Him when He was alone. They asked about the picture-story.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You were given the secrets about the holy nation of God. Everything is told in picture-stories to those who are outside the holy nation of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They see, but do not know what it means. They hear, but do not understand. If they did, they might turn to God and have their sins forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Do you not understand this picture-story? Then how will you understand any of the picture-stories?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What the man plants is the Word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those by the side of the road are the ones who hear the Word. As soon as they hear it, the devil comes and takes away the Word that is planted in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed that fell among rocks is like people who receive the Word with joy when they hear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their roots are not deep so they live only a short time. When sorrow and trouble come because of the Word, they give up and fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed that was planted among thorns is like some people who listen to the Word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the cares of this life let thorns come up. A love for riches and always wanting other things let thorns grow. These things do not give the Word room to grow so it does not give grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed that fell on good ground is like people who hear the Word and understand it. They give much grain. Some give thirty times as much grain. Some give sixty times as much grain. Some give one hundred times as much grain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Is a lamp to be put under a pail or under a bed? Should it not be put on a lamp-stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything that is hidden will be brought into the light. Everything that is a secret will be made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have ears, then listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Be careful what you listen to. The same amount you give will be given to you, and even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who has, to him will be given. To him who does not have, even the little he has will be taken from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The holy nation of God is like a man who plants seed in the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He goes to sleep every night and gets up every day. The seed grows, but he does not know how.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth gives fruit by itself. The leaf comes first and then the young grain can be seen. And last, the grain is ready to gather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the grain is ready, he cuts it. The time of gathering the grain has come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “In what way can we show what the holy nation of God is like? Or what picture-story can we use to help you understand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed that is planted in the ground. It is the smallest of all seeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After it is put in the ground, it grows and becomes the largest of the spices. It puts out long branches so birds of the sky can live in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were able to understand, He spoke the Word to them by using many picture-stories.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus helped His followers understand everything when He was alone with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was evening of that same day. Jesus said to them, “Let us go over to the other side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After sending the people away, they took Jesus with them in a boat. It was the same boat He used when He taught them. Other little boats went along with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A bad wind storm came up. The waves were coming over the side of the boat. It was filling up with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was in the back part of the boat sleeping on a pillow. They woke Him up, crying out, “Teacher, do You not care that we are about to die?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got up and spoke sharp words to the wind. He said to the sea, “Be quiet! Be still.” At once the wind stopped blowing. There were no more waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to His followers, “Why are you so full of fear? Do you not have faith?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were very much afraid and said to each other, “Who is this? Even the wind and waves obey Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and His followers came to the other side of the sea to the country of the Gerasenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got out of the boat. At once a man came to Him from among the graves. This man had a demon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lived among the graves. No man could tie him, even with chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many times he had been tied with chains on his feet. He had broken the chains as well as the irons from his hands and legs. No man was strong enough to keep him tied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Night and day he was among the graves and in the mountains. He would cry out and cut himself with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man with the demon saw Jesus a long way off, he ran and worshiped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man spoke with a loud voice and said, “What do You want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I ask You, in the name of God, do not hurt me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the same time, Jesus was saying, “Come out of the man, you demon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked the demon, “What is your name?” He said, “My name is Many, for there are many of us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons asked Jesus not to send them out of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were many pigs feeding on the mountain side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons asked Him saying, “Send us to the pigs that we may go into them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus let them do what they wanted to do. So they went into the pigs. The pigs ran fast down the side of the mountain and into the sea and died. There were about 2,000.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who cared for the pigs ran fast to the town and out to the country telling what had been done. People came to see what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jesus and saw the man who had had the demons. He was sitting with clothes on and in his right mind. The men were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had seen it told what had happened to the man who had had the demons. They told what had happened to the pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked Jesus to leave their country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got into the boat. The man who had had the demons asked to go with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus would not let him go but said to him, “Go home to your own people. Tell them what great things the Lord has done for you. Tell them how He had pity on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man went his way and told everyone in the land of Decapolis what great things Jesus had done for him. All the people were surprised and wondered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went by boat over to the other side of the sea. Many people gathered around Him. He stayed by the sea-shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jairus was one of the leaders of the Jewish place of worship. As Jairus came to Jesus, he got down at His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cried out to Jesus and said, “My little daughter is almost dead. Come and put Your hand on her that she may be healed and live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went with him. Many people followed and pushed around Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman had been sick for twelve years with a flow of blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had suffered much because of having many doctors. She had spent all the money she had. She had received no help, but became worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She heard about Jesus and went among the people who were following Him. She touched His coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she said to herself, “If I can only touch His coat, I will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the flow of blood stopped. She felt in her body that she was healed of her sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the same time Jesus knew that power had gone from Him. He turned and said to the people following Him, “Who touched My coat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His followers said to Him, “You see the many people pushing on every side. Why do You ask, ‘Who touched My coat?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked around to see who had done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman was filled with fear when she knew what had happened to her. She came and got down before Jesus and told Him the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be free from your sickness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus spoke, men came from the house of the leader of the place of worship. They said, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher anymore?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard this. He said to the leader of the Jewish place of worship, “Do not be afraid, just believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He allowed no one to go with Him but Peter and James and John, the brother of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to the house where the leader of the place of worship lived. Jesus found many people making much noise and crying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went in and asked them, “Why is there so much noise and crying? The girl is not dead. She is sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laughed at Jesus. But He sent them all out of the room. Then He took the girl’s father and mother and those who were with Him. They went into the room where the girl was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the girl by the hand and said, “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the girl got up and walked. She was twelve years old. They were very much surprised and wondered about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke sharp words to them that they should not tell anyone. He told them to give her something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went from the house of Jairus and came to His home town. His followers came after Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the Day of Rest He began to teach in the Jewish place of worship. Many people heard Him. They were surprised and wondered, saying, “Where did this Man get all this? What wisdom is this that has been given to Him? How can He do these powerful works with His hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is He not a Man Who makes things from wood? Is He not the Son of Mary and the brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon? Do not His sisters live here with us?” The people were ashamed of Him and turned away from Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “One who speaks for God is respected everywhere but in his own country and among his own family and in his own house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus could do no powerful works there. But He did put His hands on a few sick people and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wondered because they had no faith. But He went around to the towns and taught as He went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called the twelve followers to Him and began to send them out two by two. He gave them power over demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them to take nothing along with them but a walking stick. They were not to take a bag or food or money in their belts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were to wear shoes. They were not to take two coats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Whatever house you go into, stay there until you leave that town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does not take you in or listen to you, when you leave there, shake the dust off your feet. By doing that, you will speak against them. For sure, I tell you, it will be easier for the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day men stand before God and are judged than for that city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they left. They preached that men should be sorry for their sins and turn from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put out many demons. They poured oil on many people that were sick and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Herod heard about Jesus because everyone was talking about Him. Some people said, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead. That is why he is doing such powerful works.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other people said, “He is Elijah.” Others said, “He is one who speaks for God like one of the early preachers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod heard this, he said, “It is John the Baptist, whose head I cut off. He has been raised from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod had sent men to take John and put him into prison. He did this because of his wife, Herodias. She had been the wife of his brother Philip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John the Baptist had said to Herod, “It is wrong for you to have your brother’s wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herodias became angry with him. She wanted to have John the Baptist killed but she could not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod was afraid of John. He knew he was a good man and right with God, and he kept John from being hurt or killed. He liked to listen to John preach. But when he did, he became troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herodias found a way to have John killed. Herod gave a big supper on his birthday. He asked the leaders of the country and army captains and the leaders of Galilee to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The daughter of Herodias came in and danced before them. This made Herod and his friends happy. The king said to the girl, “Ask me for whatever you want and I will give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made a promise to her, “Whatever you ask for, I will give it to you. I will give you even half of my nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went to her mother and asked, “What should I ask for?” The mother answered, “I want the head of John the Baptist.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the girl went to Herod. She said, “I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a plate now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod was very sorry. He had to do it because of his promise and because of those who ate with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once he sent one of his soldiers and told him to bring the head of John the Baptist. The soldier went to the prison and cut off John’s head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took John’s head in on a plate and gave it to the girl. The girl gave it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s followers heard this. They went and took his body and buried it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers of Jesus came back to Him. They told Jesus all they had done and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Come away from the people. Be by yourselves and rest.” There were many people coming and going. They had had no time even to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went by themselves in a boat to a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people saw them leave and knew who they were. People ran fast from all the cities and got there first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus got out of the boat, He saw many people gathered together. He had loving-pity for them. They were like sheep without a shepherd. He began to teach them many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day was almost gone. The followers of Jesus came to Him. They said, “This is a desert. It is getting late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell the people to go to the towns and villages and buy food for themselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Give them something to eat.” They said to Him, “Are we to go and buy many loaves of bread and give it to them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “How many loaves of bread do you have here? Go and see.” When they knew, they said, “Five loaves of bread and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He told them to have all the people sit down together in groups on the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sat down in groups of fifty people and in groups of one hundred people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took the five loaves of bread and two fish. He looked up to heaven and gave thanks. He broke the loaves in pieces and gave them to the followers to set before the people. He divided the two fish among them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that the followers picked up twelve baskets full of pieces of bread and fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About five thousand men ate the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once Jesus had His followers get into the boat and go ahead of Him to the other side to the town of Bethsaida. He sent the people away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were all gone, He went up to the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was evening. The boat was half-way across the sea. Jesus was alone on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw His followers were in trouble. The wind was against them. They were working very hard rowing the boat. About three o’clock in the morning Jesus came to them walking on the sea. He would have gone past them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the followers saw Him walking on the water, they thought it was a spirit and cried out with fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all saw Him and were afraid. At once Jesus talked to them. He said, “Take hope. It is I, do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came over to them and got into the boat. The wind stopped. They were very much surprised and wondered about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had not learned what they should have learned from the loaves because their hearts were hard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they crossed the sea and came to the land of Gennesaret and went to shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus got out of the boat, the people knew Him at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ran through all the country bringing people who were sick on their beds to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever He went, they would lay the sick people in the streets in the center of town where people gather. They begged Him that they might touch the bottom of His coat. Everyone who did was healed. This happened in the towns and in the cities and in the country where He went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers and some of the teachers of the Law had come from Jerusalem. They gathered around Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had seen some of His followers eat bread without washing their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers and all the Jews never eat until they wash their hands. They keep the teaching that was given to them by their early fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they come from the stores, they never eat until they wash. There are many other teachings they keep. Some are the washing of cups and pots and pans in a special way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the proud religious law-keepers and the teachers of the Law asked Jesus, “Why do Your followers not obey the teaching given to them by their early fathers? They eat bread without washing their hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Isaiah told about you who pretend to be someone you are not. Isaiah wrote, ‘These people honor Me with their lips, but their hearts are far from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their worship of Me is worth nothing. They teach what men say must be done.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You put away the Laws of God and obey the laws made by men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “You put away the Laws of God but keep your own teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, ‘Respect your father and mother.’ ‘He who curses his father and mother will be put to death!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say that it is right if a man does not help his father and mother because he says he has given to God what he could have given to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not making him do anything for his father and mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are putting away the Word of God to keep your own teaching. You are doing many other things like this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called the people to Him again. He said, “Listen to Me, all of you, and understand this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not what goes into a man’s mouth from the outside that makes his mind and heart sinful. It is what comes out from the inside that makes him sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have ears, then listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into the house away from all the people. His followers began to ask about the picture-story.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do you not understand yet? Do you not understand that whatever goes into a man cannot make him sinful?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It does not go into his heart, but into his stomach and then on out of his body.” In this way, He was saying that all food is clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Whatever comes out of a man is what makes the man sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the inside, out of the heart of men come bad thoughts, sex sins of a married person, sex sins of a person not married, killing other people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: stealing, wanting something that belongs to someone else, doing wrong, lying, having a desire for sex sins, having a mind that is always looking for sin, speaking against God, thinking you are better than you are and doing foolish things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these bad things come from the inside and make the man sinful.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went from their towns and cities to the cities of Tyre and Sidon. He went into a house and wanted to stay there without people knowing where He was. But He could not hide Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman who had a daughter with a demon heard of Him. She came and got down at His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman was not a Jew. She was from the country of Syrophenicia. She asked Jesus if He would put the demon out of her daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Let the children have what they want first. It is wrong to take children’s food and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to Him, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the pieces that fall from the children’s table.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Because of what you have said, go your way. The demon is gone out of your daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she went to her house and found the demon was gone and her daughter was lying on the bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left the cities of Tyre and Sidon. He came back to the Sea of Galilee by way of the land of Decapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took a man to Him who could not hear or speak well. They asked Jesus to put His hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took him away from the other people. He put His fingers into the man’s ears. He spit and put His finger on the man’s tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus looked up to heaven and breathed deep within. He said to the man, “Be opened!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once his ears were opened. His tongue was made loose and he spoke as other people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them they should tell no one. The more He told them this, the more they told what He had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were very much surprised and wondered about it. They said, “He has done all things well. He makes those who could not hear so they can hear. He makes those who could not speak so they can speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days many people were gathered together. They had nothing to eat. Jesus called His followers to Him and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I pity these people because they have been with Me three days and have nothing to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I send them home without food, they may be too weak as they go. Many of them have come a long way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His followers said to Him, “Where can anyone get enough bread for them here in this desert?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “How many loaves of bread do you have?” They said, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He told the people to sit down on the ground. Jesus took the seven loaves of bread and gave thanks to God. He broke the loaves and gave them to His followers to give to the people. The followers gave the bread to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had a few small fish also. He gave thanks to God and told the followers to give the fish to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were filled. They picked up seven baskets full of pieces of bread and fish after the people were finished eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About four thousand ate. Then Jesus sent the people away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once Jesus got in a boat with His followers and came to the country of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers came and began to ask Him for something special to see from heaven. They wanted to trap Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He breathed deep within and said, “Why do the people of this day look for something special to see? For sure, I tell you, the people of this day will have nothing special to see from heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He left them. He got in the boat and went to the other side of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers had forgotten to take bread, only one loaf was in the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Look out! Have nothing to do with the yeast of the proud religious law-keepers and of Herod.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They talked about it among themselves. They said, “He said this because we forgot to bring bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said to them, “Why are you talking among yourselves about forgetting to bring bread? Do you not understand? Is it not plain to you? Are your hearts still hard?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have eyes, do you not see? You have ears, do you not hear? Do you not remember?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I divided the five loaves of bread among the five thousand, how many baskets full of pieces did you pick up?” They said, “Twelve.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When I divided the seven loaves of bread among the four thousand, how many baskets full of pieces did you pick up?” They said, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He asked, “Why do you not understand yet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to the town of Bethsaida. Some people brought a blind man to Jesus. They asked if He would touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the blind man by the hand out of town. Then He spit on the eyes of the blind man and put His hands on him. He asked, “Do you see anything?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blind man looked up and said, “I see some men. They look like trees, walking.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus put His hands on the man’s eyes again and told him to look up. Then he was healed and saw everything well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent him to his home and said, “Do not go into the town, or tell it to anyone there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and His followers went from there to the towns of Caesarea Philippi. As they went, He asked His followers, “Who do people say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “Some say John the Baptist and some say Elijah and others say one of the early preachers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter said, “You are the Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them with strong words that they should tell no one about Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things. He told them that the leaders and the religious leaders of the Jews and the teachers of the Law would have nothing to do with Him. He told them He would be killed and three days later He would be raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had said this in plain words. Peter took Him away from the others and began to speak sharp words to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned around. He looked at His followers and spoke sharp words to Peter. He said, “Get behind Me, Satan! Your thoughts are not thoughts from God but from men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called the people and His followers to Him. He said to them, “If anyone wants to be My follower, he must give up himself and his own desires. He must take up his cross and follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wants to keep his own life safe, he will lose it. If anyone gives up his life because of Me and because of the Good News, he will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does a man have if he gets all the world and loses his own soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What can a man give to buy back his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is ashamed of Me and My Words among the sinful people of this day, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when He comes in the shining-greatness of His Father and His holy angels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “For sure I tell you, some standing here will not die until they see the holy nation of God come with power!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days later Jesus took Peter and James and John with Him. He led them up to a high mountain by themselves. Jesus was changed as they looked at Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His clothes did shine. They were as white as snow. No one on earth could clean them so white.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Elijah were seen talking to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Jesus, “Teacher, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three tents to worship in. One will be for You and one for Moses and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter did not know what to say. They were very much afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A cloud came over them and a voice from the cloud said, “This is My much-loved Son. Listen to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once they looked around but saw no one there but Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came down from the mountain. Then Jesus said with strong words that they should tell no one what they had seen. They should wait until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they kept those words to themselves, talking to each other about what He meant by being raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked Jesus, “Why do the teachers of the Law say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “For sure, Elijah will come first and get things ready. Is it not written that the Son of Man must suffer many things and that men will have nothing to do with Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you, Elijah has already come. They did to him whatever they wanted to do. It is written that they would.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came back to His followers, He saw many people standing around them. The teachers of the Law were arguing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people saw Jesus and were surprised and ran to greet Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked the teachers of the Law, “What are you arguing about with them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the people said, “Teacher, I brought my son to You. He has a demon in him and cannot talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever the demon takes him, it throws him down. Spit runs from his mouth. He grinds his teeth. He is getting weaker. I asked Your followers to put the demon out but they could not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “You people of this day have no faith. How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring the boy to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the boy to Jesus. The demon saw Jesus and at once held the boy in his power. The boy fell to the ground with spit running from his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked the boy’s father, “How long has he been like this?” The father said, “From the time he was a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many times it throws him into the fire and into the water to kill him. If You can do anything to help us, take pity on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Why do you ask Me that? The one who has faith can do all things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the father cried out. He said with tears in his eyes, “Lord, I have faith. Help my weak faith to be stronger!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw that many people were gathering together in a hurry. He spoke sharp words to the demon. He said, “Demon! You who cannot speak or hear, I say to you, come out of him! Do not ever go into him again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demon gave a cry. It threw the boy down and came out of him. The boy was so much like a dead man that people said, “He is dead!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus took him by the hand and helped him and he stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus went into the house, His followers asked Him when He was alone, “Why could we not put out the demon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The only way this kind of demon is put out is by prayer and by going without food so you can pray better.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there Jesus and His followers went through the country of Galilee. He did not want anyone to know where He was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught His followers, saying, “The Son of Man will be handed over to men. They will kill Him. Three days after He is killed, He will be raised from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not understand what He said and were afraid to ask Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to the city of Capernaum and were in the house. Jesus asked His followers, “What were you arguing about along the road?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not answer. They had been arguing along the road about who was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sat down and called the followers to Him. He said, “If anyone wants to be first, he must be last of all. He will be the one to care for all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took a child and stood it among them. Then He took the child up in His arms and said to the followers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever receives one of these little children in My name, receives Me. Whoever will receive Me, receives not Me, but Him Who sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said to Him, “Teacher, we saw someone putting out demons in Your name. We told him to stop because he was not following us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Do not stop him. No one who does a powerful work in My name can say anything bad about Me soon after.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who is not against us is for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in My name because you belong to Christ will not lose his reward from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is the reason for one of these little ones who believes in Me to sin, it would be better for him to have a large stone put around his neck and to be thrown into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your hand is the reason you fall into sin, cut it off. It is better to go into life without a hand, than to have two hands and go into the fire of hell that cannot be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is where their worm never dies and the fire cannot be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your foot is the reason you fall into sin, cut it off. It is better to go into life with only one foot, than to have two feet and go into the fire of hell that cannot be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is where their worm never dies and the fire cannot be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your eye is the reason you fall into sin, take it out. It is better to go into the holy nation of God with only one eye, than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is where their worm never dies and the fire is never put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everyone will be made cleaner and stronger with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good. But if salt loses its taste, how can it be made to taste like salt again? Have salt in yourselves and be at peace with each other.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went away from the city of Capernaum. He came to the country of Judea and to the other side of the Jordan River. Again the people gathered around Him. He began to teach them as He had been doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers came to Him. They tried to trap Him and asked, “Does the Law say a man can divorce his wife?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What did the Law of Moses say?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Moses allowed a man to divorce his wife, if he put it in writing and gave it to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Because of your hard hearts, Moses gave you this Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the beginning of the world, God made them man and woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this, a man is to leave his father and mother and is to live with his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two will become one. So they are no longer two, but one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no man divide what God has put together.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the house the followers asked Jesus about this again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another is not faithful to her and is guilty of a sex sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a woman divorces her husband and marries another, she is not faithful to her husband and is guilty of a sex sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought little children to Jesus that He might put His hand on them. The followers spoke sharp words to those who brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw this and was angry with the followers. He said, “Let the little children come to Me. Do not stop them. The holy nation of God is made up of ones like these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, whoever does not receive the holy nation of God as a little child does not go into it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the children in His arms. He put His hands on them and prayed that good would come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was going on His way. A man ran to Him and got down on his knees. He said, “Good Teacher, what must I do to have life that lasts forever?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? There is only One Who is good. That is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the Laws, ‘Do not be guilty of sex sins in marriage. Do not kill another person. Do not take things from people in wrong ways. Do not steal. Do not lie. Respect your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man said to Jesus, “Teacher, I have obeyed all these Laws since I was a boy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at him with love and said, “There is one thing for you to do yet. Go and sell everything you have and give the money to poor people. You will have riches in heaven. Then come and follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man heard these words, he was sad. He walked away with sorrow because he had many riches here on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked around Him. He said to His followers, “How hard it is for rich people to get into the holy nation of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers were surprised and wondered about His words. But Jesus said to them again, “Children! How hard it is for those who put their trust in riches to get into the holy nation of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to go to heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were very surprised and wondered, saying to themselves, “Then who can be saved from the punishment of sin?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at them and said, “This cannot be done by men but God can do anything.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to say to Him, “We have given up everything we had and have followed You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “For sure, I tell you, there are those who have given up houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands because of Me, and the Good News.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will get back one hundred times as much now at this time in houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands. Along with this, they will have very much trouble. And they will have life that lasts forever in the world to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many who are first will be last. Many who are last will be first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were on their way to Jerusalem. Jesus walked in front of them. Those who followed were surprised and afraid. Then Jesus took the twelve followers by themselves. He told them what would happen to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Listen, we are going to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be handed over to the religious leaders of the Jews and to the teachers of the Law. They will say that He must be put to death. They will hand Him over to the people who are not Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will make fun of Him and will beat Him. They will spit on Him and will kill Him. But three days later He will be raised from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Jesus. They said, “Teacher, we would like to have You do for us whatever we ask You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What would you like to have Me do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Let one of us sit by Your right side and the other by Your left side when You receive Your great honor in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you ask. Can you take the suffering I am about to take? Can you be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Yes, we can.” Jesus said to them, “You will, for sure, suffer the way I will suffer. You will be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to sit on My right side or on My left side is not for Me to give. It will be given to those for whom it has been made ready.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other ten followers heard it. They were angry with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called them to Him and said, “You know that those who are made leaders over the nations show their power to the people. Important leaders use their power over the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must not be that way with you. Whoever wants to be great among you, let him care for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever wants to be first among you, must be the one who is owned and cares for all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man did not come to be cared for. He came to care for others. He came to give His life so that many could be bought by His blood and be made free from sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to the city of Jericho. When He was leaving the city with His followers and many people, a blind man was sitting by the road. He was asking people for food or money as they passed by. His name was Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He heard that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by. He began to speak with a loud voice, saying, “Jesus, Son of David, take pity on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people spoke sharp words to the blind man telling him not to call out like that. But he spoke all the more. He said, “Son of David, take pity on me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus stopped and told them to call the blind man. They called to him and said, “Take hope! Stand up, He is calling for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he jumped up, he threw off his coat and came to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “What do you want Me to do for you?” The blind man said to Him, “Lord, I want to see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Go! Your faith has healed you.” At once he could see and he followed Jesus down the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and His followers were near Jerusalem at the Mount of Olives. They were in the towns of Bethphage and Bethany. Jesus sent two of His followers on ahead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go into the town over there. As soon as you get there, you will find a young donkey tied. No man has ever sat on it. Let the donkey loose and bring it here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing that?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it. He will send it back again soon.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two followers went on their way. They found the young donkey tied by the door where two streets crossed. They took the rope off its neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men were standing there. They said to the two followers, “Why are you taking the rope off that young donkey?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two followers told them what Jesus had said and the men let them take the donkey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought it to Jesus and put their coats over it. Jesus sat on the donkey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people put their clothes down on the road. Others cut branches off the trees and put them down on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who went in front and those who followed spoke with loud voices, “Greatest One! Great and honored is He Who comes in the name of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great is the coming holy nation of our father David. It will come in the name of the Lord, Greatest One in the highest heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came to Jerusalem and went into the house of God. He looked around at everything. Then He went with the twelve followers to the town of Bethany because it was late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came from Bethany the next morning. Jesus was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along the road He saw a fig tree with leaves on it. He went over to see if it had any fruit. He saw nothing but leaves. It was not the right time for figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the tree, “Let no one ever again eat fruit from you.” His followers heard Him say it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Jerusalem. Jesus went into the house of God. He began to make the people leave who were selling and buying in the house of God. He turned over the tables of the men who changed money. He turned over the seats of those who sold doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would not allow anyone to carry a pot or pan through the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught them saying, “Is it not written, ‘My house is to be called a house of prayer for all the nations’? You have made it a place of robbers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The teachers of the Law and the religious leaders of the Jews heard it. They tried to find some way to put Jesus to death. But they were afraid of Him because all the people were surprised and wondered about His teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, Jesus and His followers went out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning they passed by the fig tree. They saw it was dried up from the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter remembered what had happened the day before and said to Jesus, “Teacher, see! The fig tree which You spoke to has dried up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Have faith in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, a person may say to this mountain, ‘Move from here into the sea.’ And if he does not doubt, but believes that what he says will be done, it will happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this, I say to you, whatever you ask for when you pray, have faith that you will receive it. Then you will get it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you stand to pray, if you have anything against anyone, forgive him. Then your Father in heaven will forgive your sins also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do not forgive them their sins, your Father in heaven will not forgive your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came again to Jerusalem. Jesus was walking around in the house of God. The religious leaders and the teachers of the Law and other leaders came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked, “How do You have the right and the power to do these things? Who gave You the right and the power to do them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing also. If you tell Me, then I will tell you by what right and power I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men? Tell Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They talked among themselves. They said, “If we say from heaven, He will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But how can we say, ‘From men’?” They were afraid of the people because everyone believed that John was one who spoke for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “We do not know.” Then Jesus said, “Then I will not tell you by what right and power I do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus began to teach them by using picture-stories, saying, “There was a man who planted grapes in a field. He put a fence around it and made a place for making wine. He built a tower to look over the field. Then he let farmers rent it and went into another country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The time came for gathering the grapes. He sent his servant to the farmers to get some of the grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmers took him and beat him. They sent him back with nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The owner sent another servant. The farmers threw stones at him and hit him on the head and did other bad things to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the owner sent another servant. The farmers killed that one. Many other servants were sent. They beat some and they killed others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He had a much-loved son to send yet. So last of all he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmers said to themselves, ‘This is the one who will get everything when the owner dies. Let us kill him and we will get everything.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took him and killed him. They threw his body outside the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What will the owner of the field do? He will come and kill the farmers. He will give the field to other farmers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have you not read what the Holy Writings say? ‘The Stone that was put aside by the workmen has become the most important Stone in the corner of the building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has done this. It is great in our eyes.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders wanted to take Him but they were afraid of the people. They knew He had told the picture-story against them. They left Him and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the proud religious law-keepers and Herod’s men were sent to trap Jesus in His talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Him and said, “Teacher, we know You are true. We know You are not afraid of what men think or say about You. You teach the way of God in truth. Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should we pay or not pay?” Jesus knew how they pretended to be someone they were not. He said to them, “Why do you try to trap Me? Bring Me a small piece of money so I may look at it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought Him one. He asked them, “Whose picture is this? Whose name is on it?” They answered, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Pay to Caesar the things that belong to Caesar. Pay to God the things that belong to God.” They were surprised and wondered at Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people from the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead came to Jesus. They asked Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses gave us a Law. It said, ‘If a man’s brother dies and leaves his wife behind, but no children, then his brother should marry his wife and raise children for his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven brothers. The first was married. He died before he had any children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second married her and died. He had no children. The same happened with the third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All seven had her for a wife. All died without children. Last of all the woman died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When people are raised from the dead, whose wife will she be? All seven had her for a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Is this not the reason you are wrong, because you do not know the Holy Writings or the power of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When people are raised from the dead, they do not marry and are not given in marriage. They are like angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the dead being raised, have you not read in the book of Moses how God spoke to him in the burning bush? He said, ‘I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, He is the God of the living. So you are very much wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the teachers of the Law heard them arguing. He thought Jesus had spoken well. He asked Him, “Which Law is the greatest of all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “The greatest Law is this, ‘Listen, Jewish people, The Lord our God is one Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’ This is the first Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The second Law is this: ‘You must love your neighbor as yourself.’ No other Law is greater than these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the teacher of the Law said, “Teacher, You have told the truth. There is one God. There is no other God but Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man should love Him with all his heart and with all his understanding. He should love Him with all his soul and with all his strength and love his neighbor as himself. This is more important than to bring animals to be burned on the altar or to give God other gifts on the altar in worship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw he had spoken with understanding. He said to him, “You are not far from the holy nation of God.” After that no one thought they could ask Him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was in the house of God teaching. He asked, “How do the teachers of the Law say that Christ is the Son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David himself, led by the Holy Spirit, said, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, sit at my right side until I make those who hate You a place to rest Your feet.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David himself calls Him Lord. Then how can He be his son?” Many people were glad to hear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus taught them, saying, “Look out for the teachers of the Law. They like to walk around in long coats. They like to have the respect of men as they stand in the center of town where people gather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They like to have the important seats in the places of worship and the important places at big suppers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They take houses from poor women whose husbands have died. They cover up the bad they do by saying long prayers. They will be punished all the more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sat near the money box in the house of God. He watched the people putting in money. Many of them were rich and gave much money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A poor woman whose husband had died came by and gave two very small pieces of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called His followers to Him. He said, “For sure, I tell you, this poor woman whose husband has died has given more money than all the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all gave of that which was more than they needed for their own living. She is poor and yet she gave all she had, even what she needed for her own living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went out of the house of God. One of His followers said to Him, “Teacher, look at the big stones and these great buildings!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Do you see these great buildings? All these stones will be thrown down. Not one will be left standing on another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sat down on the Mount of Olives at a place where He could see the house of God. Peter and James and John and Andrew came to Him. They asked without anyone else hearing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us when this will be. What are we to look for when these things are to happen?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus began to say to them, “Be careful that no one leads you the wrong way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people will come using My name. They will say, ‘I am Christ.’ They will turn many to the wrong way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you hear of wars and much talk about wars, do not be surprised. These things have to happen. But the end is not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator
