verses.text: Nations will have wars with other nations. Countries will fight against countries. The earth will shake and break apart in different places. There will be no food for people. There will be much trouble. These things are the beginning of much sorrow and pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Watch out for yourselves. They will take you to the courts. In the places of worship they will beat you. You will be taken in front of rulers and in front of kings because of Me. You will be there to tell them about Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are put into their hands, do not be afraid of what you are to say or how you are to say it. Whatever is given to you to say at that time, say it. It will not be you who speaks, but the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A brother will hand over a brother to death. A father will hand over his son. Children will turn against their parents and have them put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated by all people because of Me. But he who stays true to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will see a very sinful man-made god standing in the house of God where it has no right to stand. Then those in the country of Judea should run to the mountains. It was spoken of by the early preacher Daniel. The one who reads this should understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is on the top of the house should not take the time to get anything out of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is in the field should not go back to get his coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be hard for women who will soon be mothers. It will be hard for those feeding babies in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that it will not be during the winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days there will be much trouble and pain and sorrow. It has never been this bad from the beginning of time and never will be again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the Lord had not made those days short, no life would have been saved. Because of God’s people whom He has chosen, He made the days short.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone says to you, ‘See! Here is the Christ,’ or, ‘There He is!’ do not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some will come who will say they are Christ. False preachers will come. These people will do special things for people to see. They will do surprising things, so that if it can be, God’s people will be led to believe something wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See! I have told you about these things before they happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After those days of much trouble and pain and sorrow are over, the sun will get dark. The moon will not give light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stars will fall from the sky. The powers in the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and shining-greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will send His angels. They will gather together God’s people from the four winds. They will come from one end of the earth to the other end of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn something from the fig tree. When the branch begins to grow and puts out its leaves, you know summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when you see all these things happen, you know the Son of Man is near. He is even at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, the people of this day will not pass away before all these things have happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Heaven and earth will pass away, but My Words will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But no one knows the day or the hour. No! Not even the angels in heaven know. The Son does not know. Only the Father knows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be careful! Watch and pray. You do not know when it will happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The coming of the Son of Man is as a man who went from his house to a far country. He gave each one of his servants some work to do. He told the one standing at the door to watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, you are to watch also! You do not know when the Owner of the house will be coming. It may be in the evening or in the night or when the sun comes up or in the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may come when you are not looking for Him and find you sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I say to you, I say to all. Watch!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now two days before the supper of the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt and the supper of bread without yeast. The religious leaders and the teachers of the Law tried to trap Jesus. They tried to take Him so they could put Him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These men said, “This must not happen on the day of the special supper. The people would be against it and make much trouble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was in the town of Bethany eating in the house of Simon. Simon was a man with a very bad skin disease. A woman came with a jar of special perfume. She had given much money for this. She broke the jar and poured the special perfume on the head of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them were angry. They said, “Why was this special perfume wasted?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This perfume could have been sold for much money and given to poor people.” They spoke against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Let her alone. Why are you giving her trouble? She has done a good thing to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have poor people with you all the time. Whenever you want, you can do something good for them. You will not have Me all the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She did what she could. She put this perfume on My body to make Me ready for the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, wherever this Good News is preached in all the world, this woman will be remembered for what she has done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas Iscariot was one of the twelve followers. He went to the head religious leaders of the Jews to talk about how he might hand Jesus over to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the leaders heard it, they were glad. They promised to give Judas money. Then he looked for a way to hand Jesus over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first day of the supper of bread without yeast was the day to kill an animal. It was for the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. His followers said to Jesus, “What place do You want us to make ready for You to eat this special supper?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent two of His followers on ahead and said to them, “Go into the city. There a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will go into a house. You say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher asks, “Where is the room you keep for friends, where I can eat this special supper with My followers?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take you to a large room on the second floor with everything in it. Make it ready for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers went from there and came into the city. They found everything as Jesus had said. They made things ready for the special supper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the evening He came with the twelve followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sat at the table and ate. Jesus said, “For sure, I tell you, one of you will hand Me over to be killed. He is eating with Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were very sad. They said to Him one after the other, “Is it I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “It is one of the twelve followers. It is the one who is putting his hand with mine into the same dish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is going away as it is written of Him. But it will be bad for that man who hands the Son of Man over to be killed! It would have been better if he had not been born!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were eating, Jesus took a loaf of bread. He gave thanks and broke it in pieces. He gave it to them and said, “Take, eat, this is My body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He took the cup and gave thanks. He gave it to them and they all drank from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This is My blood of the New Way of Worship which is given for many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, that I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the holy nation of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they sang a song, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “All of you will be ashamed of Me and leave Me tonight. For it is written, ‘I will kill the shepherd and the sheep of the flock will spread everywhere.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After I am raised from the dead, I will go before you into the country of Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Him, “Even if all men are ashamed of You and leave You, I never will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “For sure, I tell you, that today, even tonight, before a rooster crows two times, you will say three times you do not know Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter spoke with strong words, “Even if I have to die with You, I will never say that I do not know You.” All the followers said the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to a place called Gethsemane. Jesus said to His followers, “You sit here while I pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Peter and James and John with Him. He began to have much sorrow and a heavy heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “My soul is very sad. My soul is so full of sorrow I am ready to die. You stay here and watch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went a little farther and got down with His face on the ground. He prayed that this time of suffering might pass from Him if it could.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Father, You can do all things. Take away what must happen to Me. Even so, not what I want, but what You want.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came to the followers and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Were you not able to watch one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch and pray so that you will not be tempted. Man’s spirit wants to do this, but the body does not have the power to do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Jesus went away and prayed saying the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came back and found them sleeping again. Their eyes were heavy. They did not know what to say to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came the third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? It is enough! Listen, the time has come when the Son of Man will be handed over to sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up and let us go. See! The man who will hand Me over to the head religious leader is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once, while Jesus was talking, Judas came. He was one of the twelve followers. He came with many other men who had swords and sticks. They came from the head religious leaders of the Jews and the teachers of the Law and the leaders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who was going to hand Jesus over gave the men something to look for. He said, “The Man I kiss is the One. Take hold of Him and take Him away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once Judas went straight to Jesus and said, “Teacher!” and kissed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they put their hands on Him and took Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the followers of Jesus who stood watching took his sword. He hit the servant owned by the head religious leader and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Have you come with swords and sticks to take Me as if I were a robber?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been with you every day teaching in the house of God. You never took hold of Me. But this has happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all His followers left Him and ran away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young man was following Him with only a piece of cloth around his body. They put their hands on the young man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaving the cloth behind, he ran away with no clothes on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They led Jesus away to the head religious leader. All the religious leaders and other leaders and the teachers of the Law were gathered there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter followed a long way behind as they went to the house of the head religious leader. He sat with the helpers and got warm by the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders and all the court were looking for something against Jesus. They wanted to find something so they could kill Him. But they could find nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many came and told false things about Him, but their words did not agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some got up and said false things against Him. They said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We have heard Him say, ‘I will destroy the house of God that was made with hands. In three days I will build another that is not made with hands.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even these who spoke against Him were not able to agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The head religious leader stood up in front of the people. He asked Jesus, “Have You nothing to say? What about the things these men are saying against You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said nothing. Again the head religious leader asked Him, “Are You the Christ, the Son of the Holy One?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I am! And you will see the Son of Man seated on the right side of the All-powerful God. You will see Him coming again in the clouds of the sky.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the head religious leader tore his clothes apart. He said, “Do we need other people to speak against Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have heard Him speak as if He were God! What do you think?” They all said He was guilty of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some began to spit on Him. They covered Jesus’ face, and they hit Him. They said, “Tell us what is going to happen.” Soldiers hit Him with their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter was outside in the yard. One of the servant-girls of the head religious leader came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She saw Peter getting warm. She looked at him and said, “You were with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter lied, saying, “I do not know Jesus and do not understand what you are talking about.” As he went out, a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant-girl saw him again. She said to the people standing around, “This man is one of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lied again saying that he did not know Jesus. Later, those who stood around said to Peter again, “For sure you are one of them. You are from the country of Galilee. You talk like they do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to say strong words and to swear. He said, “I do not know the Man you are talking about!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once a rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered what Jesus had said to him, “Before a rooster crows two times, you will say three times you do not know Me.” When he thought about it, he cried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning the head religious leaders of the Jews and other leaders and the teachers of the Law and all the court gathered together to talk about Jesus. Then they tied up Jesus and led Him away. They handed Him over to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate asked Jesus, “Are You the King of the Jews?” He said to Pilate, “What you say is true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders spoke many things against Him. Jesus did not say a word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate asked Him again, “Have You nothing to say? Listen to the things they are saying against You!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus did not say a word. Pilate was much surprised and wondered about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each year at the special supper Pilate would let one person who was in prison go free. It would be the one the people asked for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of one of those in prison was Barabbas. He, together with others, had killed people while working against the leaders of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people went to Pilate and asked him to do as he had done before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said, “Do you want me to let the King of the Jews go free?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He knew the religious leaders had handed Jesus over to him because they were jealous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders talked the people into thinking that Pilate should let Barabbas go free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them again, “What do you want me to do with the Man you call the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spoke with loud voices again, “Nail Him to a cross.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to them, “Why? What bad thing has He done?” They spoke with loud voices all the more, “Nail Him to a cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate wanted to please the people. He gave Barabbas to them and had Jesus beaten. Then he handed Him over to be nailed to a cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers led Jesus away to a large room in the court. They called all the soldiers together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers put a purple coat on Him. They put a crown of thorns on His head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Him, “Hello, King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They hit Him on the head with a stick and spit on Him. They got down on their knees and worshiped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had made fun of Him, they took the purple coat off of Him and put His own clothes back on Him. Then they led Him away to be nailed to a cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to a man called Simon who was coming from the country of Cyrene. He was the father of Alexander and Rufus. They made Simon carry the cross of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They led Jesus to a place called Golgotha. This name means the place of the skull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave Him wine with something in it to take away the pain, but He would not drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had nailed Jesus to the cross, they divided His clothes by drawing names to see what each man should take.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was about nine o’clock in the morning when they nailed Him to the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over Jesus’ head they put in writing what they had against Him, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They nailed two robbers on crosses beside Jesus. One was on His right side and the other was on His left side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen, “They thought of Him as One Who broke the Law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who walked by shook their heads and laughed at Jesus. They said, “You were the One Who could destroy the house of God and build it again in three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Save Yourself and come down from the cross.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The head religious leaders and the teachers of the Law made fun of Him also. They said to each other, “He saved others but He cannot save Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Christ, the King of the Jews, come down from the cross. We want to see it and then we will believe.” Those who were on the crosses beside Jesus spoke bad things to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From noon until three o’clock it was dark over all the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At three o’clock Jesus cried with a loud voice, “My God, My God, why have You left Me alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When some of those who stood by heard that, they said, “Listen! He is calling for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them ran and took a sponge and filled it with sour wine. He put it on a stick and gave it to Him to drink. He said, “Let Him alone. Let us see if Elijah will come and take Him down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus gave a loud cry. He gave up His spirit and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curtain in the house of God was torn in two from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain of the soldiers was looking at Jesus when He cried out. He saw Him die and said, “For sure, this Man was the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Women were looking on from far away. Among them was Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of the younger James and of Joses, and Salome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cared for Him when He was in the country of Galilee. There were many other women there who had followed Him to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the day to get ready for the Day of Rest and it was now evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph, who was from the city of Arimathea, was an important man in the court. He was looking for the holy nation of God. Without being afraid, he went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate was surprised and wondered if Jesus was dead so soon. He called the captain of the soldiers and asked if Jesus was already dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the captain said that Jesus was dead, Pilate let Joseph take the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph took the body of Jesus down from the cross. He put the linen cloth he had bought around the body. Then he laid the body in a grave which had been cut out in the side of a rock. He pushed a stone over to cover the door of the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where He was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Day of Rest was over. Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices. They wanted to put the spices on Jesus’ body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early in the morning on the first day of the week, they came to the grave. The sun had come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to themselves, “Who will roll the stone away from the door of the grave for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they looked, they saw the very large stone had been rolled away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went into the grave. There they saw a young man with a long white coat sitting on the right side. They were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Do not be afraid. You are looking for Jesus of Nazareth Who was nailed to a cross. He is risen! He is not here! See, here is the place where they laid Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and tell His followers and Peter that He is going ahead of you into Galilee. You will see Him there as He told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ran from the grave shaking and were surprised. They did not say anything to anyone because they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (It was early on the first day of the week when Jesus was raised from the dead. Mary Magdalene saw Him first. He had put seven demons out of her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went and told His followers. They were crying because of much sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not believe her when she said she had seen Him alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that He was seen again by two of His followers as they walked into the country. He did not look like He had looked before to these two people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went and told it to the others. The others did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later He was seen by the eleven followers as they were eating. He spoke to them with sharp words because they did not believe and their hearts were hard. And they did not believe the others who had seen Him since He had been raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You are to go to all the world and preach the Good News to every person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who puts his trust in Me and is baptized will be saved from the punishment of sin. But he who does not put his trust in Me is guilty and will be punished forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These special powerful works will be done by those who have put their trust in Me. In My name they will put out demons. They will speak with languages they have never learned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will pick up snakes. If they drink any poison, it will not hurt them. They will put their hands on the sick and they will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had talked to them, He was taken up into heaven. He sat down on the right side of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers went from there and preached everywhere. The Lord worked with them. The Lord showed that the Word of God was true by the special works they had power to do.)
verses.speaker: Narrator
